subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ahhh the infamous Fish!
author: black bear hollow
full_text:
So true. It's amazing isn't it? I read last night
on a site that said remote locations are better
to record due to lack of cell tower signals
which spirits claim interfere with communication.

w.

On Aug 18, 2008, at 1:14 PM, Zack Widup <w9sz@...> wrote:

>
> Yeah that's true. But it's sooo cool to go to a place out in the  
> middle
> of nowhere, miles from even simple things like electric lines and  
> radio
> towers, and get EVP responses which actually give logical answers to  
> your
> questions. It "could" be anything but the probability is that it is  
> only
> certain things. It is most likely NOT someone with a radio or other
> electronic device fooling with you.
>
> Zack
>
> On Mon, 18 Aug 2008, black bear hollow wrote:
>
> > What difference would a recording make? Especially
> > Since in this research where we usually can't see who or what
> > we're talking to. Any voice we hear or record could be anything.
> >
> > W
> >

> >> Al
> >>

> >>

> >>
> >>>
> >>> Wisteria,
> >>>
> >>> I forgot but you may be quite right! There are spirits who have  
> never been
> >>> incarnated into human form. They tend not to be involved in any

> >>> lower forms of vibration.
> >>>
> >>> Edgar Cayce spoke of them. Their souls were created as the  
> moment of
> >>> Creation. They chose not to have ever incarnated. Since their

> >>>

> >>>
> >>> I just said that in reference to Al's comments. There are a  
> cluster of
> >>> researchers who insist on tagging religious myth on research...  
> angels,
> >>> devils, heaven, hell, assuming anything visiting our plane is  
> "stuck" and
> >>> needs "saving" and ignoring other energies assuming everything  
> they hear
> >>> is or was a human mortal.
> >>>
> >>>
> >>> Yes, I've heard from many energies claiming to be many things  
> and some
> >>> never having inhabited a body.
> >>>
> >>> Wisteria
> >>> On Aug 17, 2008, at 9:45 PM, Lisby wrote:
> >>>
> >>>> I said that because all of the examples I heard of EVP by the  
> Fish Group
> >>>> has sounded very human and they have never claimed to have been  
> other
> >>>> than human that I have heard. I have to base my conclusions on  
> the EVP
> >>>> files, not speculation, even from the victims. Do you know of  
> instances
> >>>> where they audibly claimed to be nonhuman? I may have missed  
> them--I
> >>>> heard a lot of EVPs from them, but certainly not the sum total.  
> (As I
> >>>> said--I even got one myself the other day.)
> >>>>
> >>>> I think you're right that they are definitely mobile, and a  
> collective.
> >>>>
> >>>> Ann
